revised_title: Kew Committee's Annual Report on Meteorological and Magnetic Observations (1879)
tldr: The Kew Committee's annual report covers various meteorological and magnetic observations conducted during the year ending October 31, 1879. The report discusses the functioning of magnetographs, meteorological instruments, and electrograph, as well as the analysis of solar radiation, sunshine records, and thermometers. The committee also reports on the dismounting of the Wind Component Integrator due to frequent derangement and the experiments with different patterns of thermometer screens.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Meteorology and Climate Science
